results.title: Newsfront
results.creator_credit: Palm Beach Pictures, David Elfick, Richard Brennan, Phil Noyce and Bob Ellis
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the newsreel cameramen who lived and worked in Australia during the golden era of the newsreel from 1948 to 1956. Len Maguire (Bill Hunter) is a top cameraman whose devotion to his work and loyalty to his company creates conflict with both his colleagues and the people he loves. Amy (Wendy Hughes) is a production assistant working in a predominantly male environment and Len’s brother, Frank, (Gerard Kennedy) heads the Australian branch of an American newsreel company in competition with Len’s company.

results.title: Newsboy
results.brief_description: For the newsboys of Melbourne, dodging in and out of traffic and delivering newspapers is all part of the job. The promise of real adventure lies in a stolen trip down the Yarra River on a beautiful sunny day. Produced with the assistance of the Creative Development Branch of the Australian Film Commission.

results.title: News story
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Film Producers Guild, Frank A. Hoare and Gerard Bryant
results.brief_description: How an issue of one of Britain’s major newspapers is produced, from the early morning, as a reporter interviews dockers about a strike, to well into the night when the freshly printed bundles are loaded on to the trains. At the Guardian’s London Office, all sections are seen making their particular contributions towards the daily miracle of another issue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Merton Park, Film Producers Guild, Frank A. Hoare and Gerard Bryant

results.title: News review of 1949
results.brief_description: A record of international events that shaped the news in 1949. WEATHER ON RAMPAGE shows the blizzard that paralyzed America’s northwest and the hurricane that hit Florida. COLD WAR reports that the Berlin blockade of goods by Russia finally ends. EARTHQUAKE shows the devastation caused by an earthquake in Ecuador which killed thousands. RIOT! captures the violence that was triggered at the Paul Robeson concert by protestors opposing Robeson’s political beliefs. DISASTER reports on the devastating loss of lives when the ‘Noronic’ lake steamer erupted in flames at Toronto pier. REDS ON TRIAL shows the 5 year sentencing of U.S. communist leaders. TRUMAN AT U.N. delivers a speech advocating the control of atomic energy by the U.N. prior to the laying of the cornerstone of the United Nations headquarters. Narrated by Hugh James.

results.title: News Review No. 1
results.creator_credit: American and Allied Newsreels and United Films
results.brief_description: Significant events from the first 18 months of America’s participation in WWII - the mobilisation of industry, training of volunteers, and the worldwide deployment of American troops. Includes footage of the naval war in the Pacific, the Japanese threat to Australia and the battles of the Coral Sea, Midway, Guadalcanal, Solomons and Papua.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 77/145] = Chroniques de Franc
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. The kings of Notre Dame - Notre Dame defies the ages, yet through the years she has undergone numerous transformations. 2. The Veterinary - A portrait of a French country veterinary surgeon who cares for wild animals. 3. Erte - A survey of the work of set and costume designer Romain de Tietoff alias Erte. 4. The Nice International Summer Academy - An international summer school of art and music conducted in Nice by Fernand Oubradous.

results.title: News reports from France. [No. 72/83] = Chroniques de France
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: 1. Regine Crespin - Began singing at 16, three years at Paris conservatory…the story of Regine Crespin. Includes some excerpts of arias sung by the diva. 2. The Dunkirk-Marseille Thruway - 1073 kilometers of thruway. 3. The stunt man - The work of stunt man Remy Julienne, or how all undue risk must be avoided because you cannot cheat. You must not cheat. 4. Louis Malle - Louis Malle, aged 39, has directed ten major films.
